Where do you wish to use it? Can you give a demo?

I'm not sure about feishu applet environment. Based on the experience with Wechat and Baidu applet, most of the work relies on mapping the canvas provided by the applet with normal canvas API. 

No official support plan for feishu. If you want to use, please refer to Wechat applet [source code](https://github.com/ecomfe/echarts-for-weixin/tree/master/ec-canvas) and try to make similar things for feishu.

The correct place to change and report bug is https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/tree/master/types/echarts .

I would suggest making a pull request in that project.

i get another idea access it,use a warpper function  for graphic, i can  drag control points to pan
and scale,thanks

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. üéâ
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! üçµ

@100pah, thanks for your suggestions. This change seems to fix it. 
Can you provide more insights to the internal logic, that evaluates the time-series and detects an actual shift-left transition? I want to make sure, that the data that we add to the time-series is behaving correctly during the animation.

Hello @jarben, @pissang, & @Ovilia, I was wondering what the decision on this was. I ran into this as well where we have some high-frequency data on one end and it skews the shadow shown in the dataZoom. The dataZoom seems to be spacing all the points at regular intervals rather than according to their x-values. Is there a way to get the dataZoom to honor the x values that I can use today or is there a plan to address this in the future? Thanks for your guidance!

@10229428 
I can not reproduce the "Maximum call stack size exceeded" error by the 700 nodes in the bottom of https://jsfiddle.net/tianhen0527/c63wvfjr/ in the latest Google Chrome.

But theoretically the error would be thrown if the data is too deep. Based on the current implementation,
 it depends on the max stack size of the browser. The number in modern browsers would be bigger than 10k, but is legacy IE may be several thousand. 

@10229428  Could  I know what environment do you used?

Anyhow, consider that `tree` and `treemap` do not necessarily display all of the nodes, `tree` and `treemap` should 
 better be improved to raise the upper bound of the supported data levels.

``` javascript
this.el = new Text({

});
``` 

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. üéâ
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Hi everyone!

This would be a very useful feature to have !

Currently you can bypass this problem, by having one series with all the negative values and one series with all the positive values (sharing the same series name). I added an [example here as reference](https://jsfiddle.net/758vs6xe/1/). You get an empty space when you switch between the negative and the positive part of the series, but I couldn't find a way to address this.

Best regards,
Sergios.

Hi @MINDoSOFT ,

yes, I have managed to achieve what i wanted, but it is not a good way to do so. Do you know any other way of plotting 2 series with different amount of specific data points?

Thx too
